content: In mathematics, what is the only even prime number?

The only even prime number is 2. A prime number is defined as a natural number greater than 1 that has no positive divisors other than 1 and itself. Since 2 is divisible only by 1 and 2, it meets the criteria for being a prime number. All other even numbers are divisible by 2, in addition to 1 and themselves, which disqualifies them from being prime.因此
